body.description: The Dirt Devil Vibe Stick Vacuum is designed with you in mind. The lightweight design is easily portable for all your small messes. With on/off brush roll you can conveniently move from carpets to hard floors at the touch of a button.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 3-in-1 Versatility The Dirt Devil Vibe Stick Vacuum is perfect for both rugs and hard floors, and it features 3-in-1 versatility so you can take on messes anywhere in your home. Just detach the hand vacuum and you are ready for dust, dirt and crumbs on furniture, counters, shelves, upholstery and drapes.

Lightweight Design Easy clean from room-to-room and up-and-down stairs with the lightweight and compact design. Brush Roll Control Easily transition from carpet to hard floor cleaning with the touch of a button. Hand Vac Mode Simply detach the hand vac and quickly clean up the dust, dirt and crumbs on furniture, counters, shelves, upholstery and drapes. 10" Cleaning Path Provides a wide cleaning path for quick clean-ups on multiple surfaces.

Easy-Empty Dirt Cup Emptying the dirt cup is easy and mess free Hand Vac Mode Tackle any mess, anywhere with the detachable hand 10" Cleaning Path 10-inch-wide cleaning path quickly cleans up on carpets and hard floors
Less Hassle More Cleaning Power Comfort at home is our priority. Our products are designed to improve the well-being of your home because when your house feels good, it helps you to feel good too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Still performs like new after a year of use.
reviews.reviewText: Still performs like new after a year of use. Buying another for a relative. Very reliable and durable. Before this I bought a $250 plus vac that always destroyed the belt drive every few weeks. Put it to the trash and went to using this one full time. Sucks up cat hair fantastic. Even if I had bought 4 of these and rotated them I would still of had, much better than the way more expensive models. NEVER going back to fancy pancy "expensive" crap vacs. For the elderly and limited mobility like me no better vac made. Price has gone up $10 but I do not care. Thank you and your welcome!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This thing sucks (really well)
reviews.reviewText: We bought it to clean the small rugs around the house. This little guy packs quite a lot of suction. We have to hold the rugs down with our feet when using this thing. It's also very light weight. For the price and the ease of use, highly recommend. Also works on our faux hardwood floors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good suction. No handle hole to hang the stick vac.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a replacement for my Eureka 169B whose brush roll motor died after 4.4 years. The Dirt Devil Vibe SD20020 is super cheap right now $19.98 probably because DD seems to have come up with a new model that it’s releasing this month.Both the DD Vibe and the Eureka are fairly light (both are 4.4 lbs) and they both have a motorized brush roll. Both of them have a rating of 2 amperes. The suction power of the Eureka is strong but the DD Vibe’s is even stronger. The DD Vibe can pick up uncooked thin pasta (linguine) and whole peppercorn off a smooth surface. The Eureka can’t.You can remove the handle off the Eureka to convert it to a “handheld” but it’s not really a handheld vac because the floor nozzle is still attached. The DD Vibe, on the other hand, can be fully separated from its floor nozzle, converting it into a real handheld vac. It even comes with a crevice tool which is not as narrow (therefore, doesn't suck in as strongly) as the quick flip crevice tool of the Dirt Devil Scorpion SD20005RED but good enough for general hand vacuuming.The crevice tool can also attach to the handle so I don’t have to go looking for it when I need it. This is very convenient when I’m vacuuming the kitchen floor and I need to switch to a handheld to get at little pieces of debris in tight corners. I used to have to go and get a separate hand vac for this. Now, I only have to put my foot on the floor nozzle (to hold it down) while I press the nozzle release with my left thumb then pull the hand vac part off the floor nozzle with my right hand. So quick! However, I don’t think reaching down for the nozzle release button is going to be easy for people who have problems bending low. I tried lifting up the DD Vibe (so I don't have to bend that low) and pressing the release button with my thumb while the rest of my fingers hold the front of the floor nozzle, then I pulled the floor nozzle off. I was able to remove the floor nozzle without having to bend. However, some people with weaker/stiffer hands would probably find it difficult to press the button while also holding the floor nozzle. It would be easier if you can rest the floor nozzle on some higher surface (mind where you do this because the floor nozzle is dirty!) so you can press the release button without having to bend low.The cord is 15 feet long. Some people find it too short but 15 feet seems to be the standard length for stick vacs. I usually do one section of the house at a time and just replug the stick vac into another outlet when I move from room to room.The dirt cup is clear so you can easily see when it needs to be emptied. There’s a clear window over the brush roll so you can check if the brush roll is working or not.I do a lot of sewing. Threads on the floor get wound up around the brush roll as they do on any other vacuum cleaner brush roll. I turn on the stick vac (brush roll off) then take pointy-tipped scissors and snip along the length of the brush roll to cut the threads and pull them off the brush roll. The cut threads get sucked into the vacuum cleaner.The DD Vibe uses filter F77. I usually buy a spare filter so I can swap a filter in when the other one has been washed and is waiting to dry. On the Dirt Devil website, the F77 is $2.10. The price on Amazon starts at $11.29 (why?). On cleaning the filter, the owner’s manual says: “Hold filter under running water to rinse. DO NOT use soap/detergent. Tap excess water out of filter. Allow filter to COMPLETELY DRY for at least 24 hours before replacing in dirt cup.”Just “hold the filter under running water”? That must be a very clean filter. In my experience, dirt/hair/debris on vacuum cleaner filters don’t just fall off by themselves. They cling really tenaciously. I usually have to tap the filter on some hard surface and also use an old toothbrush to remove the dirt. The manual doesn’t say why detergent shouldn’t be used. Does it have some special coating that’s going to be removed by detergent? Don’t you just hate it when someone says “don’t do this” but doesn’t tell you why (and the reason is not as obvious as say “don’t touch the soldering iron bit when it’s plugged in or hot)?The DD Vibe, with a 2A rating, is already a lot better than most other stick vacs which have much lower ampere rating. I wish though that manufacturers would make stick vacs with higher power rating. My Dirt Devil Scorpion handvac is 7A. Why can’t they use that same motor on a stick vac with a motorized brush roll?There are 4 small rollers on the bottom of the floor nozzle. They roll easily on smooth surfaces (wood floors, stone tiles). However, the floor nozzle doesn’t glide well on rugs. I have super low-pile entryway, kitchen and bathroom rugs. Pushing the stick vac forward doesn’t help. It “sticks”. What works for me is lifting the stick vac, then setting it on the rug and then pulling it back. I repeat that all over the rug until I consider the rug sufficiently cleaned. Using the brush roll also fluffs up the bath rug (You know when bath rugs look so flat after so many feet have stood on it) and makes it look fresh again.Except for the handle tube (metal), everything is plastic (the brittle kind). I felt a bit of apprehension when I looked at the plastic handle and the two screw holes I have to use to screw it to the metal handle tube. There’s just very thin brittle plastic between the metal screws and the metal handle tube. Be careful when you assemble the handle. Don’t overtighten or you can crack the plastic screw holes.The end of the plastic handle doesn’t have a hole. It may not be important to some but it is very important to me. The Eureka is similar to the DD Vibe in that it also has a plastic handle and a metal handle tube. However, the plastic handle of the Eureka is thicker and has a hole. I use that hole to hang the stick vac instead of just standing it at some spot and having it fall to the floor when it gets bumped by someone or something. To compensate for the absence of a handle hole, I stationed the DD Vibe near a narrow post on which I hang a looped Velcro cable tie. I slip that loop over the post and DD Vibe so that the DD Vibe doesn’t just fall or slide down the floor.My DD Vibe was shipped by Amazon Logistics. They didn't use any shipping box at all. They just slapped the shipping label on the product box (that doesn't have any protective packing inside at all) and shipped as is. Amazon cutting corners - hate it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The Essence of Meh
reviews.reviewText: Nice little lightweight vacuum. Except.A vacuum, fundamentally, needs to do two things. First, it needs to use suction to clean. Second, it needs to be able to roll or glide over the surface it is cleaning.This vacuum really only does one of those things. Sure, it CAN clean a surface with suction, but this is horrible obfuscated by its inability to roll cleanly over said surface, instead catching on every little bump (such as the threads of a carpet) and kicking upwards, thus failing utterly to efficiently do its job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Wears out too quickly
reviews.reviewText: UPDATEAfter almost 2 years of very lightweight use, we are disappointed, it worked fine when it was new, but we did not like that you have to carefully clean it after each use because the filter inside the canister is easy to clog.Worse is the fact that you have to use a scissors to cut the hair off the roller each time otherwose the roller will not spin at all and you lose 75% of it cleaning power.More expensive units have powered brushes which makes a gigantic difference, these low cost units are really only good for very light cleanups, light dust or very light dry dirt.Once there is too much hair that wraps around the roller (very easy to do if you have anyone in the household has any hair at all on their body then its useless and picks up almost nothing because the roller is not turning.The roller also slows down due to age so after two years of light duty (we only use it once our twice a month because we have a large very powerful unit as well) so it has a short lifespan.It does have a thick rubber strip that rubs against the carpet and acts like a carpet rake, this does help move the dust/dirt but does not help life the dirt into the container.We are surprised that after 2 years of extremely light duty the roller now doesn't spin despite toe much we carefully clean it.Yes, you have to clean it by hand every time you use it, which is definitely not desirable because it is intended for quick pickups so having to them clean it means that its not quick at all.Its great that it is AC powered and NOT battery powered because the fan spins at full power all the time, the power cord is long enough that I can reach two rooms from one outlet which is convenient and it appears to be more powerful than the battery powered model we previous had from tis company.Not recommended.Original reviewWe were shocked at how tiny the box was when it arrived. Its certainly is slimmer and literally only half the weight of our previous top-of-the line battery operated Dirt Devil, yet this slim unit feels more powerful and because we plug it into the wall, it retains full cleaning power all the time and never needs to be recharged.Its an excellent cleaner, we ran over the same carpet that we just cleaned and this unit pulled up so much dirt and hair that it makes the battery operated units look useless.It's lightweight so its a joy to grab for quick pickup jobs so we don't have to drag out our huge super powerful full-size vacuum so its small size is a big plus.You can also unsnap the handle and floor sweeper to use it as a handheld unit to clean the sofa, windowsills, car seats, etc.The box it comes in is tiny so obviously you have to assemble it, but its easy. The flow sweeper snaps into the main vacuum, the shaft snaps into the top of the main vacuum, and the grip slides on the shaft, where they supply you with two black Phillips head screws, just insert the screws into the only two holes, tighten with (your own) Phillips head screwdriver, and its all set and ready to use.The 15 foot long power cord is plenty long enough, and because it is AC powered (no battery) it retains full power at all times and it never loses power no matter how long you use it, which is a great relief.Overall we are pleasantly surprised at how small and how powerful this unit really is, it is a great improvement over the previous battery operated Dirt Devils because its so light weight that it actually is much easier to use.

reviews.reviewerName: Looks like the image. Easy to fix time and date. Looks good with all black look
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great for a one bedroom apartment. Easy to clean and does it good

For the price it's done the job. The suction is better with the brush on. Easy to use, light, and easy to clean. Good for tile and wood flooring. Low carpets. Not good with mid or heavy carpets. It's alright. I've had better, but for the price it does the job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: As I live in the UK I expected the Dirt Devil to be OK for UK voltage and have a suitable plug. It did not, but an immediate refund given by the vendor, so no complaints!
I got defective piece... not getting started may be power supply issue

reviews.reviewTitle: Ligera, barata, duradera y funciona de maravilla
reviews.reviewText: "La aspiradora de juguete" Eso dijo mi madre cuando le regalé esta aspiradora, jeje obviamente al ver como funcionaba (yo tengo una) rapidamente cambió de opinión. La aspiradora es bastante ligera y manejable, si parece una aspiradora tipo Barbie ¡pero vaya que funciona!El manejo que le doy principalmente es en pisos duros, no la recomiendo para uso en alfombras porque su función es mas que nada de juntar basurita, morusas de pan y pelos de mascota (razón por la que yo la compré) de los pisos duros. Claro que la puedes utilizar en alfombras pero la potencia no es la misma que con una aspiradora tamaño adulto (jeje) y aparte de que tendrías que estar limpiando el mini filtro a cada rato.Es buena para limpieza rápida, deshacerte de los pelos de tus mascotas y para darle una pasada a tus muebles, también la puedes convertir en una aspiradora de mano para aspirar tu coche o lugares donde no puedas usar la aspiradora mientras está en modo de rueditas y cepillo. También puedes utilizarla como aspiradora de telarañas si le dejas el tubito de extensión y le quitas la parte que tiene las rueditas y cepillo. En fin, excelente mini aspiradora!**ACTUALIZACIÓN** 3 de Junio-2016La aspiradora sigue funcionando al 100 después de un poco menos de un año, lo unico malo es que la canastita/filtro que se tiene que limpiar se está rompiendo de un lado (lo que es la tela), la rotura es pequeña pero estoy seguro que esto se debe al hecho que cuando la voy a sacudir para quitarle el polvo la golpeo contra otra superficie y pues esos impactos son los que poco a poco han ido causando el daño, en realidad la culpa la tengo yo por flojo y por no enjuagar la canastita con agua como debo hacer. Obvio ya la limpio como es debido pero a todos aquellos que hacen lo mismo (golpear la canastita) les aconsejo que ya no lo hagan, ya que al romperse la tela del filtro comenzará a pasar todo el polvo al motor de la aspiradora y pues se puede descomponer, estoy seguro que no sería difícil reparar el daño, pero ya aprendí mi lección :). Fuera de eso la aspiradora sigue funcionando bien, aunque ya subió de precio de 475 pesos de cuando la compré hace un año sigue siendo un buen producto. Saludos!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's an ideal lightweight electric sweeper!
reviews.reviewText: I am 76 years old and l couldn’t mange my heavy duty vacuum, it was getting too heavy for me to push and pull back and forth. I love this little lightweight vacuum, does an excellent job.
